title: (x) Script on Saw 4 website - Tristan {Scott (self)}
content:
This is a font used on the current Saw 4 ( [www.saw4.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231133936/http:/www.saw4.com/ "www.saw4.com")) website and I was wondering if you guys might could ID it for me? I’d appreciate it..

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231133936im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/u_4583.jpg)

 [‹ (x) FIFA World Cup South Africa 2010 logo - customised Neuland {Jan E}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231133936/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37098 "Go to previous forum topic") [Can Anyone ID the fonts used on this shirt, spotted in Brighton... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231133936/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37139 "Go to next forum topic")
author: iamsk0t

comments.content: SOMEBODY GET HER OFF THE BOARD! :^D :^D :^D

well since I have those fonts already I’m gonna have to call you a liar.

=]

Scott. This does indeed look like an font. But, there’s so many of these vectorized handwriting fonts out there (mostly freeware) that this turns out to be searching for a needle in a haystack (german saying). I suggest you browse through the handwritten font categories at freefont sites (dafont for example).

well Jan for once that advice has worked out for me, the font is called “Tristan” found on dafont.com

sorry for bothering you all, i didn’t think they would be using a freeware font. =|

I’m not sure if I may say so:  
You’re welcome ;-)

I could have sworn I thanked you.. oh well.

Thank you.

Hey, I just said so because I didn’t identify the font.  
You found it yourself!  
So, the credit goes to you.

No need to thank me, really.
Yeah you’re right, I’m the man. =D
